TI_TEXT.P: Servicios de transporte por la vía pública
Usługi w zakresie publicznego transportu drogowego

SHORT_DESCR.P: Milton Keynes Council is seeking tenders from experienced transport operators for the provision of local bus services serving various parts of Milton Keynes.
The services are being tendered in 30 lots.
The tenderer may bid for any number of individual lots and combined bids for multiple lots. Tenderer submitting combined bid/s must submit bids of individual lots within the combination.

Station Square, Elder Gate, Midsummer boulevard, Saxon Gate, Silbury boulevard, Lower Ninth Street, Midsummer boulevard, Marlborough Gate, Avebury boulevard, Over Gate, Childs Way, Brickhill Street, St Michaels Drive.
One journey Schooldays.

TITLE.P: Lot 1 to 10 awarded as a single contract

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Without prejudice to the remedies provided under Part 3 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 the Contracting Authority shall incorporate a minimum 10 days standstill period at the point that an award decisionnotice pursuant to Regulation 86 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 is communicated to tenderers. The Contracting Authority shall send its Regulation 86 Notice, subject to Regulation 86(5) and (6), which shall includethe criteria for the award of the contract; reasons for the decision including the characteristics and relative advantages of the successful tenderer; the score (if any) obtained by the tenderer receiving the notice and the tenderer to be awarded the contract, and anything required by Regulation 86(3); the name of the tenderer to be awarded the contract; and a precise statement of either when in accordance with Regulation 87 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 the standstill period is expected to end or the date before which the Contracting Authority will not, in conformity with Regulation 87, enter into the contract.
